title: 'The market is right': Former Fed policymaker Mester sees fewer rate cuts next year after Trump's victory
content: The U.S. Federal Reserve could carry out fewer rate cuts than previously expected next year should President-elect Donald Trump's proposed global tariffs take hold, former Fed policymaker Loretta Mester said Tuesday.
summary: The U.S. Federal Reserve could carry out fewer rate cuts than previously expected next year should President-elect Donald Trump's proposed global tariffs take hold, former Fed policymaker Loretta Mester said Tuesday.

title: Trump backer John Paulson bows out as possible Treasury Secretary pick
content: John Paulson said he would remain in involved in implementing economic policies of President-elect Donald Trump

title: Apple won't launch a smart ring, says Oura CEO: 'It's hard to do'

title: Apple needs all four of its iPhones to be popular if it's going to reignite sales
content: Every year since 2020, when Apple moved to a four-model lineup, one of them has lagged in terms of sales.

title: Germany sets early election date for February after collapse of the ruling coalition
content: The date for the German federal election has been set for Feb. 23, earlier than Chancellor Olaf Scholz had originally proposed.

title: Boeing delivers fewest planes in October since 2020, warns factory restart after strike will take weeks
content: Boeing handed over 14 airplanes in October and said it will be several weeks before production can fully resume.
summary: Boeing handed over 14 airplanes in October and said it will be several weeks before production can fully resume.

title: Netflix ad-supported tier has 70 million monthly users two years after launch
content: Netflix's ad-supported tier, which launched in November 2022, has reached 70 million global monthly users.

title: American interest in moving abroad skyrockets after Trump's win — here's how many would actually leave

title: Oil giant Shell wins appeal against landmark Dutch climate ruling to slash emissions

title: Elon Musk is no Kissinger, but may help improve U.S.-China relations, experts say
